subject: PEL support for GPIO failure
commitMessage:
PEL support for GPIO failure

This commit logs PEL in case of GPIO line name is not valid or this line
is busy for some other purpose or I2C line itself is bad.

Test:
Tried to access some dummy GPIO line name, which doesn't exist.

root@rain111bmc:/tmp# peltool -l
{
    "0x50002D5E": {
        "SRC":                  "BD554007",
        "Message":              "GPIO line couldn't find or read.",
        "PLID":                 "0x50002D5E",
        "CreatorID":            "BMC",
        "Subsystem":            "CEC Hardware - VPD Interface",
        "Commit Time":          "03/07/2022 18:32:43",
        "Sev":                  "Predictive Error",
        "CompID":               "0x4000"
    },

root@rain111bmc:/tmp# peltool -i "0x50002D5E"
….

    "Error Details": {
        "Message":              "GPIO line couldn't be found or read."
    },
    "Valid Word Count":         "0x09",
    "Reference Code":           "BD554007",
    "Hex Word 2":               "00000055",
    "Hex Word 3":               "2E2D0010",
    "Hex Word 4":               "00000000",
    "Hex Word 5":               "00000000",
    "Hex Word 6":               "00000000",
    "Hex Word 7":               "00000000",
    "Hex Word 8":               "00000000",
    "Hex Word 9":               "00000000",
    "Callout Section": {
        "Callout Count":        "2",
        "Callouts": [{
            "FRU Type":         "Normal Hardware FRU",
            "Priority":         "Mandatory, replace all with this type as a unit",
            "Location Code":    "U78DA.ND0.WZS0042-P0-C5",
            "Part Number":      "02WF327",
            "CCIN":             "6B58",
            "Serial Number":    "Y131UF18H003"
        }, {
            "FRU Type":         "Normal Hardware FRU",
            "Priority":         "Lowest priority replacement",
            "Location Code":    "U78DA.ND0.WZS0042-P0",
            "Part Number":      "02WG676",
            "CCIN":             "2E2D",
            "Serial Number":    "Y131UF07302T"
        }]
    }
…….
……..
},
"User Data 0": {
    "Section Version": "1",
    "Sub-section type": "1",
    "Created by": "0x2000",
    "BMCState": "Ready",
    "BootState": "Unspecified",
    "ChassisState": "Off",
    "FW Version ID": "fw1020.00-41.2-275-g429803741-dirty",
    "HostState": "Off",
    "System IM": "50001001"
},
"User Data 1": {
    "Section Version": "1",
    "Sub-section type": "1",
    "Created by": "0x2000",
    "CALLOUT_IIC_ADDR": "0x0061",
    "CALLOUT_IIC_BUS": "8",
    "DESCRIPTION": "Couldn't find output line for the GPIO. Skipping this GPIO action. GPIO : SLOT10_PRSNT_EN_RSVD"
},
"User Data 2": {
    "Section Version": "1",
    "Sub-section type": "1",
    "Created by": "0x2000",
    "PEL Internal Debug Data": {
        "SRC": [
            "MRU: /sys-0/node-0/nisqually-0/ebmc-card-connector-0/ingraham-0/BMC-0",
            "I2C: bus: 8 address: 97 dest: /sys-0/node-0/nisqually-0/PCA9552-5"
        ]
    }
}
}

Signed-off-by: Alpana Kumari <alpankum@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I6f5582ea614e663133bac2e580ee5c0b36c3a038

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 6bd095f965b990cc1fc249505f3effa3410e4688

after merge conflict, got this new code.
Need to add PEL support here also.

after merge conflict, got this new code.
Need to add PEL support here also.
Will publish another patch by optimising this code.
Does this also need the CALLOUT_IIC stuff?

yes, callout iic is part of all PELs.
but instead of writing same line at multiple places I 'm trying to make it common.
that is coming with vpd-parser new patch set.
This whole code is common and should be pooled into a common function. Please do so.
I wonder if this is really needed. Don't the IIC_BUS and IIC_ADDR show up in the final PEL without having to append it top the message?

This throw will not be caught in the catch block at 483. In order for that to work, you'll have to have another try block around lines 457 through 481. Since we are anyway throwing a GPIOexception from line 480, why not simply treat a system_error as a GPIO exception and call logGpioPel?
See comment above about this throw.
I was looking for a hardware callout, isn't there one?
We get the I2C bus/addr to FRU map from the MRW XML, and apparently that device isn't in it.

Oh I see what happened, we use stoul() to convert the address string to a value with the last argument being 0, or autodetect the base, and the docs say:

 (optional) prefix (0) indicating octal base (applies only when the base is 8 or ​0​) 

so the code thinks 0061 is an octal number.

So I think you need to use either "0x61" or "0x0061".
How would this work if the various GPIOs we control have different I2C buses? I think we need to have this key within the individual presnce, preaction and postaction sections in the JSON
Some minor nits, looks good otherwise
This check seems unnecessary, boost::split should handle empty strings?
Can we have something here to indicate logGpioPel failed due to empty bus address, if above is addressed?
We don't need that. If it is empty we will have empty value with CALLOUT_IIC_BUS and CALLOUT_IIC_ADDR, but it will not fail here.
Sorry, I actually meant by that, while mentioning failure, I mean as there will be no callouts.
Why did you change this file? Please remove this change from the commit
As all the gpios processing are moved to util, this could've gone with that only.I removed it because not required.
Please don't do it as a part of this commit.
These should be added only if the if check at 632 passes

yes, that is the actual use case.
But I kept it here thought of having blank(default) data in case we don't get these values.
That is not going to add any benefit. Please add these only if we get data
This (and the code that fetches it) is only needed in teh catch block, please move them there.
This is only really needed when we get the exception, right? Can you move this to the catch block so taht we don't unnecessarily keep accessing it?
These changes are unnecessary, please remove them from this commit.
All looks good to me, Just one unrelated change.
Please revert the unnecessary line change that Sunny pointed out. Else this looks OK to me too
Why blank was removed from here?
